headline: Donald Trump's 'troublemaking' could end up benefitting Democrats: columnist
author: Brandon Gage
sentences: Walker, however, "has ducked debates, questioned evolution, allegedly exaggerated his business success and admitted to abusive behavior toward his ex-wife, for which he says he is 'accountable,'" Rubin noted, adding that Trump's support of a frenetic candidate could stimy the GOP.

The 2022 midterm elections are less than seven months away and Republican candidates and incumbents alike are banking on big wins for their party, potentially flipping the United States House of Representatives as well as the Senate.

"As CNN reported last year: 'Lake has baselessly advocated the imprisonment of state Secretary of State Katie Hobbs, who is now running for governor, over unspecified election crimes; there is simply no sign Hobbs broke the law.

"Democratic front-runner Tim Ryan would no doubt rather one of them prevail than Matt Dolan, the state senator and part-owner of the Cleveland Guardians, who insists on talking about the issues," wrote Rubin.
Thus, with that much enthusiasm propping up controversial candidates and regurgitating debunked conspiracy theories, the GOP's Trump faction is walking a tight rope with voters in 2022 and beyond.
"Consider his endorsement on Saturday of Mehmet Oz in the Pennsylvania Senate race," Rubin wrote of Trump, whose right-wing, white nationalist base went ballistic upon hearing the news.
Although he has yet to endorse far-right candidates JD Vance or Josh Mandel, who are duking it out for the Republican nomination for Senate in Ohio, Trump's vibe is very much alive.
Recall that Kemp – along with Georgia's Republican Secretary of State Brian Raffensperger – refused to overturn President Joe Biden's Electoral College victory in the 2020 election.
Lake, whose likely opponent in the general election is Democratic Secretary of State Katie Hobbs, "might be the most dogged Trump sycophant among his endorsees," Rubin explained.
Like Kemp in Georgia, Ducey also declined to decertify the outcome of the 2020 election after Biden won the Grand Canyon State and its 11 Electoral College votes.
Should Oz win the primary, Democrats no doubt will be relieved to have a mountain of opposition material to deploy in the key swing state," Rubin predicted.
"Republicans should understand that Trump will never stop dwelling on his 2020 loss — even if it drags the whole party down with him," Rubin concluded.
In Georgia, Trump has championed former football player Herschel Walker in his campaign to oust incumbent Democratic Senator Reverend Raphael Warnock.

The margin was less than 11,000 ballots, prompting a wave of pointless audits and multiple recounts at the behest of Trump and his aggrieved cult.
"Kemp is leading the race," Rubin pointed out, "but it’s not clear if Perdue/Trump supporters will turn out for Kemp in the general election."
And then there are two high-profile gubernatorial races that are soaked in Trumpism and which Rubin believes could go badly for Republicans.
Lake has also pushed for the imprisonment of unspecified journalists she claims have told lies about the election and other subjects.'"
On Monday, Washington Post opinion columnist Jennifer Rubin wondered if Trump's blessings could translate into wins – for Democrats.
The first is in Georgia, where incumbent Republican Governor Brian Kemp is facing a primary challenge from ex-Senator David Perdue.
Naturally, Trump has endorsed Perdue, who "has leaped into the mosh pit of conspiracy theories," Rubin quipped.
In that race, the battle is on for which man can out-Trump the other, and it may spell defeat for both of them.
The ex-commander in chief has thrown his weight behind a handful of congressional and gubernatorial hopefuls.
Now, as primary season kicks off, one presence looms over the GOP's chances – former President Donald Trump.
"This pick set off a firestorm of criticism, some from within his closest circle of advisers.
Former television anchor Kari Lake emerged as a deafening voice parroting Trump's "Big Lie."
Indeed, Perdue was but one of scores of GOP lawmakers to object to Biden's win.
Shocking, I know, that Trump would gravitate to such candidates," Rubin began.
"Warnock might get a break if Walker becomes his opponent," she said.

The second Trump-tainted gubernatorial spectacle is in Arizona.
Incumbent GOP Governor Doug Ducey has exhausted his two terms.
Trump's brand has also worked its way into other key races.
He lost his Senate race in 2020 to Democrat Jon Ossoff.
But will that turn out to be a boon or a burden?

And for whom?
